title.narrative: Enhancing Women’s Rights, Qualitative participation & freedom from violence-KtK
Stöd till "Förbättra kvinnors rättigheter i Rwanda, 2017-2019 (KtK)

description.narrative:
Kvinna till Kvinna har ansökt om 39 464 068 kr från Sida för genomförande av projektet "Enhancing Women's Rights Protection, Qualitative Participation and Freedom from Violence in Rwanda, 2017-2019". Projektet syftar till att bidra till ett samhälle där alla former av könsdiskriminering har upphört, där kvinnor deltar obehindrat i beslutsfattande och konfliktlösning och där kvinnors mänskliga rättigheter respekteras. Projektets tre huvudsakliga resultat på outcome-nivå är: 1) Stärkt skydd mot könsbaserat våld med speciellt fokus på förebyggande;2) Förbättrad kvalitet i kvinnors politiska och ekonomiska deltagande och deltagande i konfliktlösning; 3) Stärkt kapacitet hos Kvinna till Kvinnas partnerorganisationer att arbeta effektivt och bärkraftigt.
Den totala projektbudgeten, avrundad uppåt till 40 miljoner kronor, kommer att täckas av Sida. Skillnaden på cirka 500 000 kronor mellan KtK:s föreslagna budget och den totala projektbudgeten förklaras av ett behov av medel för att täcka kostnader för en halvtidsöversyn och en särskild revisorsgranskning av avtalen mellan KtK och dess partnerorganisationer. Totalt 15 miljoner kronor kommer att avstättas av Kvinna till Kvinna för vidareförmedling till 6-8 partnerorganisationer, som kommer att identifieras under projektets inledningsfas första halvåret 2017.

Kvinna till Kvinna has submitted to the embassy of Sweden in Kigali a project proposal worth a total budget of 39 464 068 SEK to implement a project entitled " Enhancing Women’s Rights, Qualitative Participation and Freedom from Violence in Rwanda, 2017-2019".
The project aims at contributing to having “A society where all forms of discrimination based on gender has been eradicated, where women participate fully in decision-making and conflict resolution, and where women’s rights are respected.” This will be achieved in Rwanda through implementation of three main outcomes: 1) Improved protection from gender-based violence with a specific focus on prevention; 2) Enhanced women’s qualitative participation in political and economic decision-making and conflict resolution; and 3) Increased capacity of Kvinna till Kvinna’s partner organisations to operate effectively and sustainably.
The total project budget of maximum 40 million SEK will be funded by Sida. The deviation of approximately 500 000 SEK compared to KtK's proposed budget is explained by the need for extra funds to cover costs for a Mid Term Review and for a pre-audit of the Agreements between KtK and its partner organisations. A total of 15 million SEK will be forwarded to the yet to be selected 6 to 8 local partner organisations in 3 years and the amount of funds to be forwarded to each organisation will be determined after selection and individual planning and budgeting.

sector.narrative: Women’s rights organisations and movements, and government institutions

tag.narrative: 5.5 - Ensure women’s full and effective participation and equal opportunities for leadership at all levels of decision-making in political, economic and public life.
5.5 - Tillförsäkra kvinnor fullt och faktiskt deltagande och lika möjligheter till ledarskap på alla beslutsnivåer i det politiska, ekonomiska och offentliga livet.

title.narrative: Enhancing Women's Rights,Qualitative participation & freedom from violence (KtK)
Enhancing Women's Rights,Qualitative participation & freedom from violence (KtK)
Enhancing Women's Rights,Qualitative participation&freedom from violence (KtK)

description.narrative: During the period between January 2019 and December 2019, the programme for Enhancing Women’s Rights, Qualitative participation & freedom from violence implemented by KtK achieved a number of results.The Embassy has analyzed the programme annual narrative report for 2019 and following is the summary and examples of results and almost all of them are expected with a few unexpected ones. The Embassy assesses that some results have been achieved under the first planned outcome on the improved protection from GBV with a specific focus on prevention. KtK has continued to train partners and this has further increased knowledge and skills of partners on GBV prevention especially those on legislation and policies, and norms and values underlying GBV. In addition, under the second outcome on women’s qualitative participation in political and economic decision-making and conflict resolution, KtK has continued to increase the ability of targeted women to participate qualitatively. Some women have given testimonies of how being supported by Rwanda Women Network (RWN) using KtK support, has increased their respect and recognition. When the Embassy together with CIVSAM conducted a field visit to the program activities, one young woman in Rwamagana district testified how she was elected in local leadership as a result of the empowerment she received from Rwanda Women’s Network and KtK. The Embassy also assesses that KtK further strengthened capacities of a total of 7 local women’s rights civil society organisations in 2019 but KtK has so far signed agreements with a total of 10 organisations including 8 organisations as partners and 2 supported as non-partners due to different reasons including lack of registration and lack of systems according to KtK assessment. Under outcome three on capacity strengthening of POs, KtK partners have continued to access networks that coordinate, share experiences and learn from each other which have ultimately increased organisations effectiveness and efficiency as change agents in Rwandan society to promote gender equality from the bottom up approach. The organisations have continued to address the challenge of ensuring that legislation and policies are implemented at national and local levels. The Embassy concludes that KtK has achieved good results and they have now understood the context and are fully settled to even compensate the delays experienced at the beginning of the implementation of the program. The Embassy notes in this regard that achieving the set outcomes takes time as the area of intervention (gender equality) needs more time to influence behaviours as the Embassy assessed as early as 2016. KtK has submitted a new proposal for five years and the Embassy has begun the appraisal for a possible new support, the agreement is expected to be signed before the end of the year.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
